docs.snippet: Christian David, the alleged kingpin of one of the world's largest heroin-smuggling rings, chose here yesterday to go to prison in the United States for narcotics trafficking rather than face the French guillotine for murder.
docs.lead_paragraph: Christian David, the alleged kingpin of one of the world's largest heroin-smuggling rings, chose here yesterday to go to prison in the United States for narcotics trafficking rather than face the French guillotine for murder.

headline.main: Heroin Smuggler Chooses U.S. Prison Over Guillotine

docs.snippet: In the turbulent years of World War II from 1941 to 1945, Martin Bormann had no personal forces at his command, no public appeal and virtually no allies in the court of Adolf Hitler. But his power in the Third Reich was second only to that of his...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the turbulent years of World War II from 1941 to 1945, Martin Bormann had no personal forces at his command, no public appeal and virtually no allies in the court of Adolf Hitler. But his power in the Third Reich was second only to that of his Fuhrer, and he used it ruthlessly, according to historians.
docs.abstract: article on former Nazi war criminal M Bormann says that Nuremberg Tribunal, which sentenced him to death in absentia in '46 for war crimes and crimes against humanity, found that he had been 'extremely active in persecution of Jews'

headline.main: Bormann's Power During War Was Second Only to Fuhrer's

docs.snippet: The Federal Government said yesterday that it had conclusive proof of a "complete cycle" of a complex heroin-smuggling conspiracy masterminded by Auguste Joseph Ricord, allegedly an overlord of drug trafficking in the Western Hemisphere.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Government said yesterday that it had conclusive proof of a "complete cycle" of a complex heroin-smuggling conspiracy masterminded by Auguste Joseph Ricord, allegedly an overlord of drug trafficking in the Western Hemisphere.
docs.abstract: US Fed Govt, at opening of trial of A J Ricord on Dec 5, repts it has conclusive proof of a 'complete cycle' of complex heroin-smuggling conspiracy masterminded by defendant, alleged overlord of major narcotics smuggling ring in Western Hemisphere who was extradited to US from Paraguay; describes 'business orgn,' devoted to smuggling heroin; smuggling operations detailed

headline.main: U.S. Opens Case Against Alleged Kingpin of Heroin Ring and Outlines Smuggling Route

docs.snippet: Ladislas Farago, the writer, said yesterday that he had heard in Uruguay but had not been able to cheek the detailed account of an alleged visit by Martin Bormann to Argentina. The account formed the opening of his recent series of articles asserting...
docs.lead_paragraph: Ladislas Farago, the writer, said yesterday that he had heard in Uruguay but had not been able to cheek the detailed account of an alleged visit by Martin Bormann to Argentina. The account formed the opening of his recent series of articles asserting that the former top Hitler aide was alive and prospering in South America.
docs.abstract: L Farago in NYC Dec 5; holds news conf, Kennedy Airport, on his series of articles in London Daily Express, NY Daily News and other papers; says he was not able to check rept he heard in Uruguay of alleged Bormann visit to Argentina; reasserts confidence Bormann is living; doubts photos used in article series actually showed Bormann at Argentine border, as captions indicated; speaks slightingly of '5 or 6 hastily written articles'; refers newsmen to forthcoming book to be published by Simon & Schuster

headline.main: Author Concedes He Did Not Verify Report of a Bormann Visit to Argentina

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 8 -- The General Assembly in a resolution today asked governments to avoid giving assistance that could help Israel consolidate her control of Arab territories occupied since the 1967 war.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 8 -- The General Assembly in a resolution today asked governments to avoid giving assistance that could help Israel consolidate her control of Arab territories occupied since the 1967 war.

headline.main: U.N. Asks Partial Ban on Aid to Israel

byline.original: By KATHLEEN TELTSCHSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 7 -The man who gained worldwide fame recently as the dogged "Argentine intelligence officer" who had tracked down Martin Bormann, the world's most wanted Nazi war criminal, says that he has never seen Bormann, never, in fact, even...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 7 -The man who gained worldwide fame recently as the dogged "Argentine intelligence officer" who had tracked down Martin Bormann, the world's most wanted Nazi war criminal, says that he has never seen Bormann, never, in fact, even looked for him and has no knowledge of whether he is dead or alive.
docs.abstract: J J Velasco, described in Farago articles in London Express, NY Daily News and oilier newspapers as Argentine intelligence officer who tracked down Bormann, says he has never soon Bormann, never looked for him and has no knowledge whether he is dead or alive; says documents used by Farago were forgeries; makes statements in series of interviews in Buenos Aires; investigation also discloses that man whose pictures have been published around world, identified as Bormann, is alive and well in Argentina; he is R N Siri, 54-yr-old high school teacher; Bormann would have been 72; Farago gave Velasco 1st and 2d names of Jose Juan, whereas his real names are Juan Jose; Velasco and Siri are friends; Argentine Fed Police insist none of printed documents came from their files; Comr O A Messore, after search of files, says he is authorized by Brig Gen A S Caceres, Fed Police comdr, to say there is no sign of documents in their archives; says Velasco is not a police officer; Farago also named as informant a police officer named Z I Sztemberg; Argentine police say no such man is in force; Siri, citing threats to him after publication of pictures of him as Bormann, says he has taken legal steps to sue Daily Express and NY Daily News; describes how published pictures were taken; Siri, Velasco, and Bormann illus

headline.main: Never Saw Bormann, Argentinian Declares; Argentinian Says He Never Sought Bormann Nor Saw Him

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times

headline.main: Miss Gimpel, Teacher Of Deaf, Wed ,

docs.snippet: Four Frenchmen, three Argentines, two Uruguayans, a Belgian, a Chilean and an American were charged in Federal indictments unsealed here yesterday with conspiring to import and distribute 383 pounds of heroin and 25 pounds of cocaine between August,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Four Frenchmen, three Argentines, two Uruguayans, a Belgian, a Chilean and an American were charged in Federal indictments unsealed here yesterday with conspiring to import and distribute 383 pounds of heroin and 25 pounds of cocaine between August, 1970, and Nov. 30, 1972.
docs.abstract: 4 Frenchmen, 3 Argentinians, 2 Uruguayans, a Belgian, a Chilean and an Amer are charged in unsealed Fed indictment on Dec 12 in NYC with conspiring to import and distribute 383 lbs of heroin and 25 lbs of cocaine between Aug '70 and Nov 30 '72; they are accused of having funneled narcotics from France to Argentina, where woman owner of wig shop allegedly transshipped them to US; US Atty Morse, in describing breakup of smuggling operation, estimated narcotics' retail value at $87-million; named as head of smuggling ring are C David, M Nicole, A G Condemine and J Munoz; wig shop owner identified as Y Sarmiento; others named in indictments listed

headline.main: 12 CHARGED HERE IN A WORLD PLOT TO IMPORT HEROIN; Linked to Distribution of $87-Million Worth From France via Argentina 12 CHARGED HERE IN A HEROIN PLOT
Sir Eugen Millington. Drake. j Envoy in Graf Spee Battlei

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile: President Salvador Allende Gossens has been an admirer of Fidel Castro since paying the first of his eight visits to Havana in 1959 during the first heady days of Castro's victorious revolution. Allende enjoys Castro's animal...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile: President Salvador Allende Gossens has been an admirer of Fidel Castro since paying the first of his eight visits to Havana in 1959 during the first heady days of Castro's victorious revolution. Allende enjoys Castro's animal vitality and restless political mind. They share a gusto for talking, for good food and drink, and for the company of attractive women.
docs.abstract: J de Onis article on nature, purpose, leadership and tactical skills of Chilean opposition that has been organized by anti-Marxist pol parties, middle-class orgns and other public sectors as alternative to Pres Allende's socialist program; ex-Pres Frei's favorable electoral position and mil's role in preventing left- or right-wing dictatorship discussed; illus; illus of Allende and Cuban Premier Castro

headline.main: The opposition in Chile; Said Castro to Allende: "If you don't get those people under control, the revolution is not going to succeed. We were never up against anything like this in Cuba." Opposition in Chile Dynamic duo
